etymology.description: 又(又) (yòu, "hand") holding 𰀁(𰀁) (a brush) -> originally referred to 筆(筆) (bǐ, "writing brush") -> borrowed for 聿(聿) (yù, "thereupon")
etymology.interpretation: The character 聿(聿) (yù, "brush") originates from an image of a hand holding a brush, closely associated with writing implements. The character was later borrowed for the meaning "thereupon."
